reviews.text: This was such a fun tour! We got there a bit late but Kat (like cat) 😂 was so awesome and gave us a tour even though we got there late. She was kind and funny and knowledgeable! Beautiful historical home that will make you feel like you stepped back in time. Only $6 dollars for adults and for 12 and under is $4. We came on a Sunday and it was probably the best time too!  Tour is about 30 mins.
Pretty much is house turned into a museum that shows very good history lesson about one of the oldest families in Denver. Is a 30 min tour and has a tour guide and gift shop. Recommended
Love places like these... Will definitely re-visit.

I had a group from South Suburban Parks and Recreation attend a tour here.  The docent did an excellent job with the tour.  Thank you!! We'll definitely offer the tour for our Active Adults again in the future.
I loved the tour and my tour guide Kat was super knowledgeable!

This is one of my favorite Children's Museums that I've taken my son to. It has a lot of different areas that I've never seen at other museums. The bubble room was a lot of fun and they have a large outdoor area to play around as well! My favorite part of all was something I've never seen at another museum. The quiet/nap room!! This is an absolute necessity at places like these!! My son started to get extremely cranky and we were able to go in this room, dim the lights and just calm down for a while. What a wonderful idea!! I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Denver.

This place is amazing, really clean and quality all around. My kids love everything about this place. Can be a quicker trip than expected due to the small sizes of exhibits and the amount of people that are there. Good for really young ages and they have a toddler room that's totally padded and a shoes off area.

I absolutely love taking my 4-years-old son and 4-years-old niece to spend quality time together. There are a lot of educational and fun activities for everyone. Children can play with toys in different rooms. Highly recommend visiting. You won't be disappointed

We have a membership and my young kids love playing here! The fire truck, ball section, and outside water and sand areas are favorites. It’s almost always packed, though, especially during the week with school groups. You can see field trip numbers on their website, though, which helps in planning to go or stay away.

Our kids (6 and 2) love spending the day here. We got the membership so we could spend more time there without feeling like we need to do or see everything in one day. They’ll spend hours playing with the kitchen or building things. Be sure to sign up for a spot to make food at the kitchen as it always fill up fast!

Spend the $28 for the exhibit that is currently going on. We went to the Dior exhibit and it was extremely well worth it. It had an audio experience as well as a highly visual one. 

The main art museum may seem small but it is currently going through a renovation that is slated for 2020. The staff is super friendly and welcoming. Their social media is very up to date and informative and they are super knowledgeable about the pieces that they have. Great date night!!!

Nice exhibits, though limited to 3-4 in the entire museum. This may be due to extensive renovations. $13 entrance was reasonable for the offering. Overall valuable experience.

Note: to use the lockers you need $.25, which will be refunded. The lockers are mostly too small for a normal sized backpacks.

The Denver art museum is a great place for a quick visit while downtown. They provide a wide range of interesting exhibits. We just so happened to be there as the Dior show was going on. Although there was an extra fee it was well worth it. You got to see pieces from every era of Dior up close and personal. A truly one of a kind experience.

Great exhibits, great staff, nice layout! Parking is difficult in this part of Denver so be prepared to walk far or refill the 1-hour meter outside if you can find a spot nearby. Loved the Dior exhibit that was there when we went. Nice gift shop, as well.
Had fun spending quality time with my 13 year old son, he would have much rather spent his day at the mall. All kids his age just want to spend money. Overall was a very clean, classy facility.

Great place.  All the stuffs of a natural history variety.  Mineral and gem collection is incredible.  Planetarium with awesome shows about outer space, our solar system, etc. Fossil collection is very impressive IMO. you want to see some GIGANTIC dinosaur skeletons towering dozens of feet overhead? You can find some of that here too.  It appeared also an impending opening of a new exhibition.  And I could surmise; they’re always updating and adding new stuffs! Super busy the day I was there.  
I’m 49.  I think it would be awesome if they offered at least ONE DAY FOR ADULTS ONLY, in a given month or something because it was just a SEA of small children- sadly most of whom could care less and might rather be at an indoor FUN FAIR!   Loved the museum, wish I could enjoy it on an adult only adventure!

3 incredible floors of exhibits. There were so many different things to see and for the kids to play with. After we left they had a hard time picking out what their favorite was.
I was more than impressed by the quality and layout of all of the exhibits, most notably the dinosaurs and space exhibits.
The natural history areas were extremely well done, too.
Didn't get a chance to try the coffee shop, but the T-Rex Cafe was great, especially when compared against other museum/zoo restaurants.

Definitely warrants many future visits!

**Heads up - as it is located next to city park, the parking was very crowded when we were leaving the museum (early Saturday afternoon). There were a lot of activities happening in the park, which I'm sure was what caused the congestion.
When we arrived at 930am the lot had plenty of parking. So if you're bringing younger kids you may want to aim for an early arrival on the weekends.

We greatly enjoy having a family membership to this museum. Each visit reveals a wonderful balance between the particular and the infinite in any few steps. There are other balances, as well - between the educational and experiential, between the interest of adults and the passions of children, between art and science. This is a first-class museum, with so much more to offer than can be encompassed in just one visit.

Favourite place to go with the kids and would actually love to go sometime without them too. The exhibits are interactive and updated frequently so there's always new stuff. They have this big open section with videos projected on the floor of running dinosaurs and the kids have a riot chasing them. The kids section is a perfect way to wear toddlers out... we get the extended family annual pass every year and it's worth every dollar.

This is a wonderful place and I’m glad I went. We spent hours and still didn’t see everything. This is great for all ages. I really enjoyed the dinosaur area the most. The staff was nice and helpful when we needed direction. It was neat to see so many parts of history illustrated so well. Great visit over all

Being a fan of Margaret - not Molly-  Brown this tour was a highlight during our recent trip to Denver..  Our tour guide was well-informed, entertaining, and was happy to share all the information about Margaret Brown that has been amassed. Truly impressive was the philanthropist that Margaret Brown was. She rallied for all funds for her fellow survivors of the Titanic as well as being a fundraiser throughout her entire life.  The basilica in downtown Denver is certainly one of the recipients of funds raised.  A True American rags to riches, then back to rags story this 45 minute tour through the Margaret Brown house is definitely a good use of your time. Don’t overlook the fine detailing in the house- amazing workmanship to be sure!

Our tour guide, Erin, was one of the best tour guides we've ever had anywhere. The house is just fantastic! We loved hearing the real story of Margaret (Maggie) Brown and how it differed from the Molly legend that was mostly invented after her passing. History Colorado does such a great job with each of their sites, and this one is no exception. We had the unexpected after-tour bonus of a meet-and-greet with "Ms. Brown" herself and she was just as lovely and gracious as could be. We thoroughly loved this adventure and can't wait to come again soon!

I had a wonderful tour of the molly brown house during my stay in Denver. I was fortunate to go during a time that there wasn’t too much people taking tours and was the only person taking a tour at the time. It was a more comfortable atmosphere that way and Sind I didn’t have to share my guide I feel like I got a lot more out of the tour. My guide was a wonderful lady who definitely knew her stuff, and made sure i enjoyed my tour. The house itself is full of history and held a lot of meaningful material to learn from, not to mention beautiful. I definitely came away with a new found respect for “molly” Brown. The tour Was inexpensive but they also offer student discount as long as you bring your student ID. Overall it was very educational and enjoyable.

The Docent was awesome and knowledgeable but the time frame to enjoy the tour and tea was very rushed.  The tea and food was delicious, but, the actress that played Margaret Brown used her "Spiritual" beliefs and politics too much.  Instead of taking about Margaret Brown she compared her to Michelle Obama, various colors, and the times that she "channeled" Mrs. Brown. None of this is what I paid to hear about.  
All in all, the tea was nice but too rushed to really enjoy for the price.  And, like I said, not enough about "Molly" Brown.

Awesome tour! I was happy to have my misconceptions about "The Unsinkable Molly Brown" cleared up. Very organized and efficient crowd management. I highly recommend taking this tour while in Denver. If you have a teacher or military ID you can get a discount.

Thoroughly enjoyed our visit...
Great stop on the Santa Fe Art District stroll.
Staff is very kind and informative
The exhibitions are wonderfully curated. Learn something new at every turn.

Not sure how to find the Museo De Las Americas? Look for the bold  (and newly-painted) pink exterior among the shops, galleries, and businesses on Santa Fe. Talk about eye-catching!

I have visited this museum many times over the last decade, and every trip has been memorable. I feel that their educational offerings for children and students are particularly strong. They have interesting classes for children that take place in the basement, and the activities combine art-making with historical or cultural lessons.

It's not just a museum for children, however; often the exhibits are challenging and provocative (as art should be). The current exhibit is "Espacio Liminal/Liminal Space." A multi-artist show curated by artist Frank Lucero, it includes paintings as well as multimedia pieces and sculptures, a variety of abstract and realistic (if heightened) artwork, and an interactive installation, too. Certainly these pieces could make a powerful impression upon a young viewer, but the ways liminality are expressed both in Latino culture and in these works of art will be noticed best by adults.

Museo de las Americas is a small museum, but foot by foot, it is perhaps the most innovative and exciting museum in Denver. I strongly encourage everyone to visit the Museo.
This is a really cool but quick little museum worth checking out. They also host parties and it’s a really interested event space.
I saw the latest exhibit here. It was so cool to see the juxtaposition of NASA photos against the Aztec codecs.

This was such a great museum. I loved it! My husband is a huge baseball fun so it was great to take him there. This is an awesome collection and the volunteers/workers love to share details and the history behind pieces. I love the way it’s organized. Not too big, but definitely packed with fun memorabilia!

If you love baseball, and more specifically, the Baseball Stadiums of years gone by, do not miss this museum.  A taste of all the jewels of the NL and AL throughout the 20th century.  Loved the visit!

Made a trip to this place last week and it was worth every penny.  Very cool artifacts.  I think I walked around 9-10 times just so I wouldn't miss anything.  Very small place but packed with history.  How many times are you able to see a Babe Ruth autographed baseball in you life?

A true gem in the heart of Denver. Relatively small, but so much to see! Packed floor to ceiling and aisle to aisle with a fantastic collection of baseball artifacts and memorabilia. A must-do for any baseball fan. Go more than once if you can, to make sure you see everything!
Super cool kind of hole in the wall place.  Don't expect fancy, but if you are a true baseball fan who appreciates off the wall places, you'll love this.  Highly recommend!
Sunnyside is an amazing park, I was there for the Coca Cola Classic Disc Golf Tournament. Awesome weekend.
Loved the park with the rolling hills and trees. Had a wonderful firepit and frisbee golf
Nice relaxing place to picnic or just chill and listen to nature.
Nice quiet place to camp without the noise. Secluded and safe
Nice playground equipment, lots of shade trees, not much traffic. Nice place to have a picnic and play.

The best thing I suggest is: "reach here with your family!"
That's perfectly amazing! There are lot of other family spending time here, chat with them. You'll definitely love this place.

What makes this place so cool is exactly it's beauty!
Have a great time :)

I've been going to the Denver Zoo since I was a kid and each time there really is something new. I miss the red pandas, but I was excited to see the larger habitats they are building for all of their animals. I know that for many animals, the larger the better, and I like that they are making strides toward helping the animals be more comfortable. I vote for larger feline and bear enclosures next!!
It was a great experience. I'll go back and I recommend that you do, too!

Really pretty zoo but lots of construction going on.  Definitely missed seeing some animals because of it.   Really nice elephant area.  Loved that the lions were right at the entry.  We enjoyed the zoo over all and added one more zoo to our US zoos seen list.

The best place to relax, enjoy and educate our children about animals. 
The place was clean and environmental, there are more things you can do or work with your student if you a teacher on a field trip. I have to say Denver Zoo is one of the best places I've ever been to. I would love to recommend this to everyone who loves animals.

The Zoo is a decent place to take children too for a day outing. The animals are well cared for and the food they offer is adequate. Though if your looking to cut expenses I would bring a lot of snacks or eat a large breakfast or lunch before venturing into the Zoo. Also bring comfortable shoes for if your at the zoo, you're likely to be doing plenty of walking and will be on your feet for the whole day if your with kids.
This is a small and beautiful park near the Susquehanna and Chenango rivers. The place is good for a picnic and would be nice rest from walking.
Beautiful little park at the confluence of the Susquehanna and Chenango rivers. The river walk is one of my favorite places in the city.
Very nice well-kept good for picnic or public get together
Not very big. History explained on a plaque. Nice for a rest from walking.
Scenic local park at the confluence of the Susquehanna and Chenango Rivers.

They serve up some damn good NY style pizza.  When in need of just a slice or two, I come here because for one thing,  they are open late. Secondly,  they are quick to heat up some specialty sliced pizza slices.    

If in the need for some decent somewhat greasy pizza or sandwich,  this is the spot. Prices aren't bad either. Just know that, there isn't much standing room inside where you place your food order.

Great late night pizza, wings and etc. No frills, eat that greasy slice on the curb.

Edit; just be careful. As they state they are open late but they shut down cooking food besides basic leftover pizza slices early on weekdays according to their staff. Not as advertised.

This is a review in two parts 

1) the food: it's fine pizza, in the way all pizza that doesn’t make you sick is fine pizza. I grew up in NYC, I've had more slices of pizza and slice shops outside the Stadium than these guys have seen Yankee games. It's not NY pizza 

2) Delivery: I live 2.5 miles, a 12 minute drive from the establishment. Apparently I'm two far for them to delivery, however. Just out of curiosity, what is the range you'll deliver in? The block your located on?

This place is 0/2 and have no interested in giving them a third strike.
Best pizza in town! Thank you to the staff for delivering on such a rough night of snow. Stay safe out there.

I got a slice of pepperoni pizza - that thing is HUGE and is probably three pieces of chain store pizza. The pepperoni has a slight kick to it and there was some kind of flavor to the sauce or cheese (unsure which) that was a nice addition. This place is really tiny but they make good pizza. It wasn't that greasy either which I thought was great. But what I really think is cool is that if you get a slice of pizza, you have lots of customization because you can add a variety of toppings to your slice for just 50 cents each. Pretty cool. They also sell snickers and twix ice cream bars which wins me over.

Now I don't give 5 star ratings unless it is a 5 star. The only hinge would be if you are not into retro, Pulp Fiction type diners. Totally out of the 70s. If you think those diners have a cool atmosphere, this is an excellent breakfast location. ALL the ingredients were natural and fresh. It was very busy when the family was there, but the kitchen staff is on par.  The food was out sooner than expected. We had a plethora of eggs, pancakes, meats, breads, fruit, and it was all perfect.  The biscuits and gravy were incredible. Just look at the pics, nevermind the kids. All of that and the menu provided. Great job Breakfast King!!!!

Just perfect for breakfast! Food is always fresh and tasty, the portions are good sized, and the service is fast and friendly. It is opened 24/7, so if you want to have dinner at night, this is the place to go. I would definitely return!

I like the old school diner vibe, and staff is really nice. The food tastes "homemade" and the prices are very good-large portions too. Being open 24/7 saved me when I needed it most after my late night shifts in Denver.

An absolute throwback. Nothing has changed in decades. (and I mean that in a good way) Ever wondered what an authentic diner experience is like? This is it. My favorite is the Hot Hamburger, but pretty much anything with green chili on top is amazing.

Welcome to 1972. The decor and the employees have been here ever since! It's open 24-7-365 and nobody else in town has the amazing decor you can find here. The food comes out fast and hot. Everything is delicious. It may claim to be the king of breakfast but with food that's so out of this world it should be called breakfast astronaut.

I should have tried a burger that they are known for, but I wasn't hungry for that and my group chose the restaurant.   I had the enchiladas.  Not good, had a sweet sauce and small enchiladas.   My dirty martini was sweet also.  Not happy with food.  However service and atmosphere was good.

Absolutely loved this place! I had never had a bison burger before and theirs was so tender, juicy, and seasoned to perfection. The fries were fresh and seasoned well too with the perfect amount of crispiness. Our waitress was so friendly and attentive. Do yourself a favor and go here as soon as possible!

Able to accommodate large parties and had great service. Great food and nothing everything came out as expected and delicious. They were on time with most things and apologetic with things that were not. I overall do recommend for really any size of party.

Very Large, casual, down home burger bar. Completely build your own satisfaction on a bun. My combo was great, of course. But the things that make any burger great like, size, beef flavor, type of bun, serving style, etc, they nailed every single one. Highly recommended!!!
If you only have time for one stop in Denver then this is the place. The original best burger in town. The staff is amazing. It's an experience you cannot miss.

The perfect place to grab breakfast, lunch, or dinner. The breakfast bowls are made to order, and will definitely fill you up and  start your day right. The service if fast, friendly, and you can tell how good the food is by the line that goes out the door for lunch. A fair value for the amount of food they give you. So if you love fast, friendly service and delicious food, Illegal Pete's on Pearl Street is the perfect stop for breakfast, lunch and dinner.
Always delicious. During peak times there can be a bit of a wait but what are you gonna do? It's good and a lot of people want it. Great value.

Awesomeness 101....
This was my first time here, but I loved it. Would be even better in summer when it's not so cold.

If You’re a CU Boulder student who wants a burrito. Go to this location after 7 and take advantage of free parking. 

If you’re a CU Boulder student who wants a bar to drink at, go to the one on the hill. 

If you go to the one on the hill on the weekend and find it too crowded, this location is your answer. This one is focused on food on the weekends. The other one is a bar on the weekends.

Very nice fast and friendly service along with yummy fish tacos and i really enjoyed their selection of drink choices too!!👍👍

Down to earth and very kind people vibe made me feel compfy and quite welcome!!☺☺ Next time visiting i plan on inviting several friends to join me too.

If you like my review click the like icon below please...
Went to get a massage upstairs and it was awesome. The woman had some strong fingers if you like deep tissue. Me not so much but she did let up on the pressure, so it was very enjoyable!

I bought my daughter's Jade necklace here. Lots of choices if you are looking for that type of thing and very inexpensive for real Jade compared to department stores and jewelry stores. They have a beauty section, a stationery section, dishes section and everything else in between. My daughter and I love this store. It's located in Little Saigon.

I really like the shops in this area.. I really love the produce at this Safeway... The store is always super clean.... The parking lot however is usually loaded with people asking for money and I usually have to park further away from the store than I consider to be reasonable....
Love this shopping center! Great food. Good services. Good groceries!

I haven't been here for a long while, last time was here about a year ago. Weekday nor weekend its always filled with shoppers, weekend its double filled good luck finding a spot to park, seldom I come to shop or dine , mostly come to upgrade and remodeled or repairs on one of the restaurant in here. I am happy to see bussiness do well and attract lots of people. I recommend you come and browse around, you will like it.

Nearly full, cozy, noisy conversation, huge helpings, tasty (not too much salt).  Friendly, efficient waitress.   Be glad to go again, any time.

I had gyros scrambled eggs, hash browns, and green tea. They didn't have white tea or hot chocolate.  It was all tasty.

Great local dive diner, with fast, friendly service and great prices for the amount of food you get. It's definitely diner food and the chef cooks only in butter (yum), so definitely not healthy by any means, but super good. Limited vegetarian options so not sure how often I will frequent, but my experience was great, I got the Greek vegetarian omelette at 8 o clock at night.

Great late-night dining experience. Quintessential old 50s type diner. Food is hot oh, good, and reasonably priced. Serving staff is fantastic and I would recommend the Greek salad for the gyros late evening for a 2 a.m. snack

My family have been coming here for well over ten years. Today was a not so pleasant experience. My food seemed cold, as if it had been sitting out too long. We have a descent sized family and they were unable to accommodate us with round tables, e.g. we had to keep scooting in and so on for waitresses to move about. Also had a heap of plates that weren't picked up til almost the end. I feel it's a common courtesy to pick them up when returning to fill drinks etc. I also work for a restaurant and felt a lot of things were missed. Our waitress said she was here for 13 years, but the service we received was poor. Also used cigarette butts on the floor. Never saw anyone sweeping. Photos of two meals.

This place was great. Service was fast and friendly. Portions were huge! I had a cheese omelet, fried potatoes, and a short stack. Luckily my family helped me finish off the pancakes! Hubby got a Hot Hamburger. (Burger covered with American chili.) He said it was his favorite meal the whole trip! 

Almost forgot to mention the fries. Delicious!!

First time at this place. My Aunt has been coming here for over 20 years. It's her favorite spot in Denver. Love the NM/CO flavor these burritos have. Not super spicy, maybe needs more eggs than rice, but otherwise delicious!
Real mexican flavor! I'm from Juarez and decided to visit this place to give it a try after running into a sudden taco crave. The flavor is really good. Def. Recommended

Fantastic! A diner/five with great Green Pork Chile. We shared a small bowl of the Chile stew, and we each had a burrito smothered with that wonderful stuff.

I will definitely return the next time I am in Denver!

4/5 for this spot is a legitimate rating. It's not a fancy please by any means, but it's certainly a place that makes authentic Mexican foods, and has no frills. You know what you're getting and are never disappointed. Places like this enjoyable because the menu is simple, the food is prepared quickly, and the staff are honest. I'd prefer this spot over the more posh places in Denver. At least at El Taco, I'm always happy with the food.

This small restaurant is legendary... It possibly inspired Chipotle's start. Great authentic menu and genuinely tasty food in a modest/busy dinner type atmosphere. (I first enjoyed this establishment's unique cuisine about 32 years ago, when it was first getting started at this location. A favorite was the, novel at the time, giant foil wrapped barbacoa burrito masterpieces that contained diced onions, green chili, white cheese and cilantro rice. These burritos are still available)

Been coming here since 2011 and I have to say a lot has changed over time but love the new layout. So pizza is always amazing. Love 2 tables in particular since you get to play old  arcade games. Love the new bar area and that it's in a different section from the main restaurant. Like that the bar side has a dance floor. Love the gender neutral bathroom is always a plus plus for me.

This place is seriously cool inside! The bar tender was super friendly and attentive. Four stars because my drink was awful. Ordered a vodka soda with lime. I said I didn't care which vodka I got (bottom shelf, but that's on me) and it was mixed with water :/ asked him to fix it and got it back with water again.  i think it was more an issue with the club soda than the tenders knowledge of the drink though

This place is a glorious hole in the wall. It doesn't look like the type of place you would like but it is amazing. It is one of my guilty pleasures. I wish I ate there more often. I think I go like once a year. But the custom by the slice pizza isn't something you should pass up if you are in the area.

Our favorite pizza place in Colorado! We go at least once a month. They have the best pizza in Colorado. It's a must visit. The staff is great, the beer is great and they have table top Mrs. Pacman... I mean, come on.

I was not impressed by the pizza we ordered. Very bland but we ate it anyway since we were starving and it was too late to order elsewhere. Tables were wobbly. Hotty Toddy drink ordered at the adjacent Double Daughters bar was awful too. Didn't even drink more than a sip or two and left it. The decor is beautiful and that's about all there is positive to say.
Bacon wrapped dates are fantastic! I was too full on dates to try dessert, but my mouth was watering each time I saw one come out. Will definitely have to go back to try dessert too!

I've been to D Bar Denver twice and both times food and service were amazing. The chocolate cake was delicious, just out of this world! I really like to try other dessert items. From now it is my go to place for desserts.

Easily one of the coolest restaurants in Denver. Awesome food and atmosphere. Everyone is extremely nice. Their dessert section is also phenomenal. I rarely end up saving myself for dessert, although I always want to. Portions are good. Unique dishes, but they are ALL so good. Me and my fiancé's favorite place to dine currently.

What a disaster. This place used to be so good. We loved the atmosphere and the food. The deserts and drinks were so yummy and creative. The last 3 times we have been there the bar has been 75% empty and many tables 20+%empty. We were told there was over a 30 minute wait   We waited a while and no one showed up.  The take out is a small subset of their normal deserts and are obviously not made at the restaurant but more likely Cisco. It was such a great place but either horrible management or they can’t  keep staff. A sad end to an exciting place.  Needless to say they have lost many customers

If you have a sweet tooth then this place is calling your name. If you're bold enough stop by solely for a milk shake or oozing chocolate molten cake at their old school diner bar. If you're really hungry than their dinner plates are equally delicious. Decently priced but on the more expensive side of average meal costs in Denver. Service is impeccable.

Amazing food! I ordered the ginger steak daily special and was blown away at the amount of food and flavor I got for the modest price. My girlfriend was also extremely pleased with her dish. The decor and setup of the restaurant was very pleasing and quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful with menu selections. A great place to try if your in the area and have the munchies!
Surroundings are lovely.  Service is impeccable.  The food is wonderful. Especially the ginger ice cream! Would love to take a tub of that home.  Definitely a favorite location to dine.

I have one friend who considers this his favorite restaurant in all of Denver, and it's easy to see why. It's a traditional American-ish Chinese restaurant with attentive staff and classic decor. When I've eaten there, the food has always been very good. Many of my favorites are from the appetizer menu, especially their vegetarian hot, sour, and spicy soup.

So a couple of weeks ago my partner and I ordered the Thai chicken dish. We were disappointed with the dish and did comment to one of the staff about our displeasure. At that time we were fully charged for the meal however she verbally promised a complimentary meal if we returned. Stupid me I thought she was sincere when she stated this and I did not get it in writing. She was very apologetic and I just went by her word. We have been coming to this establishment for years. When we returned tonight after driving 40 minutes, the manager Lynn said they never promise a meal but instead credit the meal if the customer is not happy. I explained that an older member of her staff promised a complimentary meal and did charge the full price of that meal. I was made to feel like a thief and disrespected as I stood there in the lobby area being questioned. I decided to walk out knowing I would never again return here after being treated in this way. She was rude and certainly not in the business of customer service.

What a great way to say goodbye to the old year and hello to the New Year. We had a fantastic NYE dinner at Imperial Chinese. The menu offers many delicious choices, the four of us decided to eat family style so we ordered 3 entrees. Yes 3, they are very generous in their serving size. We selected the Sesame Chicken, Nanking Pork Loin and Lemon Chicken. The Pork Loin was so tender you didn't need a knife to cut it.
Ordering 2 chicken dishes might seem strange but the flavors are very different and most satisfying. We also ordered a plate of vegetable fried rice and the taste was fantastic. The wine list is perfect and the bottle prices are most affordable. As you can imagine they were very busy on this NYE but the service was fantastic. The ambiance is awesome and the restaurant is tastefully decorated in an upscale Asian motif. The menu was a special NYE Holiday Menu and their regular menu has even more offerings. Looking for an excellent Chinese restaurant, look no further and go to Imperial Chinese.

Great selection of authentic Vietnamese cuisine, although the sheer amount of items on the menu can be a bit overwhelming. The rice wrap dishes have always been a personal favourite and smorgasbord of grilled meats and vegetables for sharing. The grilled meats were slightly on the dry side, for my liking, but the flavour was on point.Feeds 3 for modest appetites and easily two with larger ones.
My favorite for the past 20 years! Vietnamese ice coffee and pork wraps are out of this world. Service is efficient. The decor has improved with time. The menu has something for everyone.

THE BEST! I absolutely love this place. The food is amazing, and generously priced...3 lobster tails in the lobster dish for $25?!? You’d be hard pressed to find that deal at a supermarket, much less a delicious restaurant. The food’s splendor is equaled by wonderful, friendly service. I love bringing my friends here, we always have a great time and leave happy!

Great food and even better service!
We had a party of 10 that turned into 12! They didn't even blink an eye! Pulled up a few more chairs and our extra guests never even knew they weren't part of the plan!
Thanks for the great birthday!

A gem on Federal. Giant menu. Great service. Upscale style dining room, particularly compared to other Vietnamese in the area. Food is excellent. I don't do too much seafood, but they proudly serve a plethora. The vegetarian egg rolls are unreal. A must have. Good prices. Servers are friendly anis polite.

Met my daughter for breakfast. Great selection of breakfast foods. Loved that every single item had the calorie count. So helpful! The sweet potato and kale breakfast bowl was very tasty with lots of textures! The breakfast tacos were very good too. Wait staff is attentive, patient and attentive. Busy place for Wednesday morning at 10am. Had a little wait but shopped fur a few things away Trader Joe's to pass the time. Great decor too. Felt like I stepped into a Jetson's episode. Would definitely go back.

Stopped by here while driving through Denver because of the great reviews we read. It was pretty tasty. Not the most amazing breakfast place I've been too, but it was an enjoyable breakfast. They had very unique breakfast drinks. Mine wasn't very good, but I only tried the one. The service here was very nice and attentive though!

Snooze used to be one of my favorite breakfast places ever. Service is still usually fantastic ... the food used to be consistently delicious. Now it's pretty hit or miss. The last few times either my order has come out wrong or my stomach got sick after eating here. I usually choose other places before Snooze, but it's still fun to go every once in a while.  Go early or expect a solid wait.

The wait is worth it! Good breakfast options.  Had an enjoyable experience here. The staff is friendly and hospitable to your needs. You feel welcomed and you feel like you got your money's worth. Good bang for the buck. Highly recommend to my friends,  A++++++++++

not only is this place adorable but the service was fantastic. i told the server i was looking for a vegan option and she helped ensure that i was satisfied with it. had a cup of earl grey tea, a side of fruit, and two DELICIOUS tofu tacos. highly recommend!!

Great spot with excellent service. I've only been to the bar a few times but each time it's been worth it. Jeff and Al were professional, personal and not the sort of bartenders who bug you every second. Can't recommend them highly enough. The front are was also professional and Alice was helpful (even when I think she was off shift and I had a quick question.) Over all, great spot for professionals to grab a drink or bite mid day or late evening.
One of the best meals I've ever had. 6 course meal that was paired excellently with wine. Top notch service. Will absolutely be back!
Great service from time of entry to finish. Special food and Chef's attention to the restaurant guests. Most recommended. Ha...and their 🍷 selection is impressive.

Did the eight course tasting menu, the food was pretty darn good.  Would have liked a little bit more variety in the courses but overall I enjoyed it a lot.  The ambience was mediocre, and we were one of two or three tables there on a friday night.

What a disappointment it was tonight!!! 

Other than one waiter (not ours), the staff was pretentious, slow, and terrible at the simplest tasks. We even wondered if we were supposed pick up our food from the kitchen and then clear our own table.

The food was terrible. I had the red trout which had no flavor which came with the greasiest flavorless cheese rice cake on the planet. When I mentioned the bad rice cake to the owner or manager, she had the gall to blame the flavor on the oil from the cheese. Nice try. I asked for a side of mashed potatoes as a replacement and got a pile that seemed to have been sitting in the stove all day. My date had a seasonless steak with creamed spinach that had more nutmeg than your grandmother’s eggnog.

Bottom line. Save your money and don’t bother.

This restaurant is magical! My wife and I love the decor, the ambience, the service, and especially (of course) the food. From the appetizers to the desserts, every serving is perfection. The Barolo Grill is certainly one of Denver's finest restaurants. 

We recently spent the evening there to celebrate my daughter's engagement, and we couldn't have made a better choice. The food was wonderful. Every dish was both elegant and delicious. The servers were quite attentive, their timing was impeccable, and the ambience was perfect. We give the Barolo Grill our highest recommendation.

This place was very good. The food was delicious and the staff was great. Our server Nicole was very knowledgeable about every dish that was served to us. She also knew what wines went well with every dish and explained why they complemented each other. On top of that Adam the manager stopped by our table to introduce himself just to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. I thought it was a nice touch he also found out it was a special night for my wife and I so he through in a special desert on the house. The cheesecake is amazing but I must say everything I had was great and well presented. This would be a great place to take a date or someone for a special evening. It is impressive. Also I know parking can be a worry in that area but they have valet at the front door. I suggest using it. I recommend Barolo grill to anyone.

Fantastic Italian food! The favors are so rich and memorable. It's even better that the menu rotates by season. I'm always amazed by the creativity and knowledge the restaurant offers its guest. Highly recommend!
One of the best Italian meals I've ever had...and I've been to Italy, and grew up Italian. If you want to impress guests, bring them here. Dates? Yes. Your mom? Yes. Phenomenal pasta.

Excellent Italian food and service.  The atmosphere and friendly staff is a wonderful experience. I would rate their food as some the best in Denver. The chef blends the flavors perfectly. Pretty hard to beat their delicious menu selections.

We went for a Valentine's dinner and it was fantastic! I'd recommend a reservation though, it was packed. The food, drinks and desserts were some of the best Italian food we've had in Denver. Service was a little slow, but that was expected with how busy it was. Great location downtown by Union Station too. Will definitely be back again in the future.

Wanted some Italian near Union station and ended up choosing here for a weekday for lunch, it was delicious. The boar in my pasta was extremely tender and made me want to try cooking some boar. 
The noodles are homemade, and nothing compares to homemade noodles. Will definitely return for more of their noodles. 
Our server was very helpful and had awesome recommendations for what to eat. 

Their dinner menu is more expensive than their lunch menu, so I would really recommend going for lunch if you want to save some money. But you can see both menus and prices on their website.  

Our reservation was lost but I think that was an issue with the service they use to make them.

Really enjoyed coming here! The ordering wine via tablet was fun.  Food was excellent. The portion I got looked small but was very filling. Will definitely come here again next time I want to do a nice dinner in Denver.

staff was really nice and food was great. Fine recipes. pricey but it’s definitely worth the views, luxury and everything with it. I recommend this restaurant if you want to enjoy some wine along with your dinner. It’s also right in front of the union station.
Heavenly food, amazing staff, and super friendly service! Definitely coming back here. 👍
Thanks

This market was unique and very cute to all through. I feel like they have too many homemade weaves basket vendors (in my opinion there could be other, different shops in place). The Shea Butter store was really cool, I enjoyed learning the history and origin of the Shea Butter that was imported from Africa. It’s nice seeing the product in its raw form rather than in a bottle in a store aisle. Very cool!

The Market is on our list every time we visit Charleston. It's bustling and right in the center of historic downtown. Tons of vendors offer a wide variety of local products and the food options are great. Our go-to Market snack are Callie's Hot Little Biscuits, which are out of this world. I love that there is a clean public restroom inside.

Bring your walking shoes and experience local artisans, bakers, woodworkers --and merchandise resellers! Sift from booth to booth to discover some real local crafting. Many resellers offer the same merchandise priced at outrageously different prices. So if you see something you thought you'd never see again at a fair price, keep walking... You'll probably find it for half its price a few booths from there. This market sits at the heart of historical Charleston, and you can walk to rainbow row, the Battery and other key free attractions within minutes. Convenient public bathrooms are located at this market.

A plethora of quality hand crafted creations. The sea grass baskets are well made and many designs available.
 Beautiful paintings are reasonably priced. Sterling jewelry selections are abundant.

The place is very busy but it's a tourist attraction, lots and lots of history good to know and learn. The sights are beautiful the water is too. It is very family oriented, lots of things to see and do, everyone is nice! Kinda pricey but it's an attraction so don't expect to be cheap but you can enjoy the place and learn too
